channel.title: Finance on Archive 03

item.title: When Will the U.S. Government Shutdown Finally End?
item.description: The U.S. federal government shutdown has entered its 33rd day, nearing the longest record in history. As tangible damages like the suspension of SNAP food assistance and unpaid federal employee salaries spread, optimistic and pessimistic views on when the shutdown will end are in sharp conflict.
